intro: Gautiera procumbens, commonly known as the creeping gautieria, is a low-growing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Gautiera procumbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
